qas.question: What did Francis Marcus say of the Chinese relief effort?
What uncharacteristic attitude did China display?
What kind of attitude did Burma display in response to a cyclone a few days earlier?
How long before the quake did Cyclone Nargis strike Burma?
What organization did Francis Marcus represent?

answers.text: International Federation of the Red Cross

context: Francis Marcus of the <a4_0>International Federation of the Red Cross<a4_0/> praised the Chinese rescue effort as "<a0_0>swift and very efficient<a0_0/>" in Beijing on Tuesday. But he added the scale of the disaster was such that "we can't expect that the government can do everything and handle every aspect of the needs". The Economist noted that China reacted to the disaster "rapidly and with uncharacteristic <a1_0>openness<a1_0/>", contrasting it with Burma's <a2_0>secretive<a2_0/> response to Cyclone Nargis, which devastated that country <a3_0>10 days<a3_0/> before the earthquake.
